name: Jean Holiday Dunham
tweet: THANKYOU governor for all you have done to help ND slow the spread. That has been accomplished and now it is time to open ND for business. My county (Grand Forks) has been stable with 11 cases for one week. 10 hospitalized statewide with 2600 beds available. Open up ND!

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet:
Our positive case rate remains the 2nd-lowest in the nation at 3% (308 positive/10,350 total tests), and our per-capita testing rate ranks 9th among states. 

Together, we can continue to #SlowTheSpread and save lives. Be #NDSmart: stay home, stay healthy, stay connected. (4/4)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We continue to fine-tune our hospital surge plan with our health care providers and partners. We're confident we will have the capacity we need should a surge of positive cases occur in ND. As of today less than 1% of our hospital beds are being used for COVID-19 patients. (3/4)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We don‚Äôt expect to need these Tier 3 facilities at the Fargodome and University of Mary Fieldhouse in Bismarck, but it's our responsibility to protect the health & safety of our citizens and prepare for the worst-case scenario. (2/4)

name: Tom Kennelly
tweet: Your doing a great job Gov. a common sense approach! Refreshing! Well Done!

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Gov. Walz and I also agreed, for the health and safety of our citizens, they should avoid all nonessential travel. Stay home, stay healthy, and stay connected. (2/2)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: To protect the most vulnerable and slow the spread, I also signed executive orders requiring self-quarantine for positive cases of COVID-19 & their household members, as well as an executive order suspending visitation to long-term care facilities. http://www.governor.nd.gov/news/burgum-signs-executive-orders-slow-spread-covid-19-limit-visitation-nursing-homes¬†‚Ä¶

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We appreciate all who have watched our press briefings over the past two weeks. Please note that there will not be a briefing today. Briefings will resume at 4 p.m. Monday, March 30.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We urge you to seek out facts from official sources:  http://health.nd.gov¬†,  http://NDresponse.gov¬†,  http://coronavirus.gov¬† #COVID19ND #NDSmart

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: A recent viral post claims that the President would enact a mandatory nationwide quarantine. When asked about this in his press conference today, the President said, ‚ÄúWe are working with the Governors and I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll ever find that necessary.‚Äù

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Also issued additional guidance with @NDDPI Supt. Kirsten Baesler for K-12 schools to educate students with alternative delivery methods beginning April 1. School buildings will remain closed to students until further notice, with access for essential staff only.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The decision was made in an effort to reduce the rate of infection and allow time to gather more data, better assess testing and treatment capabilities and plan for education in the event of an extended COVID-19 pandemic. The situation will be reassessed at the end of the week.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We encourage citizens to be prepared and not panic. Take this virus seriously and follow recommendations for reducing its spread. We are constantly working with stakeholders to stay on top of this rapidly evolving situation. Stay tuned for a press conference at 9 a.m. tomorrow.
